Speaker: Search Team Leader
Line: Are you the guys from Washington.

Speaker: SHIELD Tech
Line: You get many other visitors out here.

Speaker: SHIELD Lieutenant
Line: How long have you been on site.

Speaker: Search Team Leader
Line: Since this morning. A Russian oil team called it in about 18 hours ago.

Speaker: SHIELD Lieutenant
Line: How come nobody spotted it before.

Speaker: Search Team Leader
Line: It’s really not that surprising. This landscape’s changing all the time. You got any ideas what this thing is exactly.

Speaker: SHIELD Lieutenant
Line: I don’t know. It’s probably a weather balloon.

Speaker: Search Team Leader
Line: I don’t think so. You know we don’t have the equipment for a job like this.

Speaker: SHIELD Tech
Line: How long before we can start craning it out.

Speaker: Search Team Leader
Line: I don’t think you quite understand. You guys are gonna need one hell of a crane.

Speaker: SHIELD Lieutenant
Line: Base, we’re in. What is this. Careful.

Speaker: SHIELD Tech
Line: Lieutenant. What is it.

Speaker: SHIELD Lieutenant
Line: My God. Base, give me a line to the Colonel.

Speaker: Voice from Earpiece
Line: It’s 3 am, sir.

Speaker: SHIELD Lieutenant
Line: I don’t care what time it is. This one’s waited long enough.

Speaker: Jan
Line: They have come for it.

Speaker: Tower Keeper
Line: They have before.

Speaker: Jan
Line: Not like this.

Speaker: Tower Keeper
Line: Let them come. They will never find it.

Speaker: Hydra Lieutenant
Line: Open it. Quickly, before he…

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: It has taken me a long time to find this place. You should be commended. Help him up.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: I think that you are man of great vision. And in this way we are much alike.

Speaker: Tower Keeper
Line: I am nothing like you.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: No, of course. But what others see as superstition, you and I know to be a science.

Speaker: Tower Keeper
Line: What you seek is just a legend.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Then why make such an effort to conceal it. The Tesseract was the jewel of Odin’s treasure room. It’s not something one buries. But I think it is close, yes.

Speaker: Tower Keeper
Line: I cannot help you.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: No. But maybe you can help your village. You must have some friends out there. Some… some little grandchildren perhaps. I have no need for them to die.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Yggdrasil. Tree of the world. Guardian of wisdom and fate, also. And the Führer digs for trinkets in the desert. You have never seen this, have you.

Speaker: Tower Keeper
Line: It’s not for the eyes of ordinary men.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Exactly. Gove the order to open fire.

Speaker: Hydra Lieutenant
Line: Jawohl.

Speaker: Tower Keeper
Line: Fool. You cannot control the power you hold. You will burn.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: I already have.

Speaker: 4F Doctor
Line: O’Connel, Michael. Kaminsky, Henry.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Boy, a lot of guys getting killed over there.

Speaker: 4F Doctor
Line: Rogers, Steven.

Speaker: Enlistment Guy
Line: It kind of makes you think twice about enlisting, huh.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Nope.

Speaker: 4F Doctor
Line: Rogers. What did your father die of.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Mustard gas. He was in the hundred and seventh infantry. I was hoping I could be assigned…

Speaker: 4F Doctor
Line: Your mother.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: She was a nurse in a TB ward. Got hit, couldn’t shake it.

Speaker: 4F Doctor
Line: Sorry, son.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Look, just give me a chance.

Speaker: 4F Doctor
Line: You’d be ineligible on your asthma alone.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Is there anything you can do.

Speaker: 4F Doctor
Line: I’m doing it. I’m saving your life.

Speaker: Commercial Announcer
Line: War continues to ravage Europe. But help is on the way. Every able-bodied young man is lining up to serve his country. Even little Timmy is doing his part collecting scrap metal. Nice work, Timmy.

Speaker: Loud Jerk
Line: Who cares. Play the movie already.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Hey, you wanna show some respect.

Speaker: Commercial Announcer
Line: Meanwhile, overseas, our brave boys are showing the Axis powers that the price freedom is never too high.

Speaker: Loud Jerk
Line: Let’s got. Get on with it. Hey, just start the cartoon.

Speaker: Steve Roger
Line: Hey buddy, you wanna shut up.

Speaker: Commercial Announcer
Line: Together with Allied forces, we’ll face any threat, no matter the size.

Speaker: Loud Jerk
Line: You just don’t know when to give up, do you.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I can do this all day.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Hey. Pick on someone your own size.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Sometimes, I think you like getting punched.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I had him on the ropes.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: How many times is this.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Oh, you’re from Paramus now. You know it’s illegal to lie on the enlistment form. And seriously, Jersey.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You get your orders.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: The one-o-seventh. Sergeant James Barnes. Shipping out for England first thing tomorrow.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I should be going.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Come on, man. My last night. Gotta get you cleaned up.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Why. Where are we going.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: The future.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: I don’t see what the problem is. You’re about to be the last eligible man in New York. You know, there’s three and a half million women here.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Well, I’d settle for just one.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Good thing I took care of that.

Speaker: Connie
Line: Hey, Bucky.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: What did you tell her about me.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Only the good stuff.

Speaker: Expo Announcer
Line: Welcome to the Modern Marvels Paviliion and the World of Tomorrow. A greater world. A better world.

Speaker: Connie
Line: Oh, my God. It’s starting.

Speaker: Mandy
Line: Ladies and gentlemen, Mr Howard Stark.

Speaker: Random Woman
Line: I love you, Howard.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Ladies and gentlemen, what if I told you that in just a few short years, your automobile won’t even have to touch the ground at all.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Yes. Thanks, Mandy. With Stark robotic reversion technology, you’ll be able to do just that.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Holy cow.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: I did say a few years, didn’t I.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Hey, Steve, what do you say we treat these girls…

Speaker: Woman
Line: Come on, soldier.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Come on. You’re kind of missing the point of a double date. We’re taking the girls dancing.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You go ahead. I’ll catch up with you.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: You’re really gonna do this again.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Well, it’s a fair. I’m gonna try my luck.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: As who. Steve from Ohio. They’ll catch you. Or worse, they’ll actually take you.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Look, I know you don’t think I can do this.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: This isn’t a back alley, Steve. It’s war.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I know it’s a war. You don’t have to tell me.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Why are you so keen to fight. There are so many important jobs.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: What am I gonna do. Collect scrap metal…

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Yes.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: …in my little red wagon.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Why not.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I’m not gonna sit in a factory, Bucky.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: I don’t…

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Bucky, come on. There are men laying down their lives. I got no right to do any less than them. That’s what you don’t understand. This isn’t about me.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Right. Cause you got nothing to prove.

Speaker: Connie
Line: Hey, Sarge. Are we going dancing.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Yes, we are. Don’t do anything stupid until I get back.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: How can I. You’re taking all the stupid with you.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: You’re a punk.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Jerk. Be careful.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Don’t win the war till I get there.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Come on girls. They’re playing our song.

Speaker: Young Doctor
Line: Wait here.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Is there a problem.

Speaker: Young Doctor
Line: Just wait here.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Thank you. So, you want to go overseas. Kill some Nazis.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Excuse me.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Dr Abraham Erskine. I represent the Strategic Scientific Reserve.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Steve Rogers.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Where are you from.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Queens. 73rd Street and Utopia Parkway. Before that, Germany. This troubles you.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: No.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Where are you from, Mr Rogers. Mmm. Is it New Haven. Or Paramus. Five exams in five different cities.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: That might not be the right file.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: No, it’s not the exams I’m interested in. It’s the five tries. But you didn’t answer my question. Do you want to kill Nazis.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Is this a test.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Yes.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I don’t wanna kill anyone. I don’t like bullies. I don’t care where they’re from.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Well, there are already so many big men fighting this war. Maybe what we need now is the little guy, huh. I can offer you a chance.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Only a chance.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I’ll take it.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Good. So where is the little guy from, actually.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Brooklyn.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Congratulations, soldier.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Are you ready, Dr Zola.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: My machine requires the most delicate calibration. Forgive me if I seem overcautious.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: And are you certain that those conductors of yours can withstand the energy surge long enough for a transference.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: With this artifact, I am certain of nothing. I fear it may not work at all.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Twenty percent. Forty. Sixty. Stabilising at 70%.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: I have not come all this way for safety, Doctor.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: What is that.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: I must congratulate you, Arnim. Your designs do not disappoint. Though they may require some slight reinforcement.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: The exchange is stable. Amazing. The energy we have just collected could power my design, all my designs. This will change the war.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Dr Zola, this will change the world.

Speaker: Officer
Line: Ready, exercise.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Recruits, attention. Gentlemen, I’m Agent Carter. I supervise all operations for this division.

Speaker: Gilmore Hodge
Line: What’s with the accent, Queen Victoria. Thought I was signing up for the U.S. Army.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: What’s your name, soldier.

Speaker: Gilmore Hodge
Line: Gilmore Hodge, your Majesty.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Step forward, Hodge.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Put your right foot forward.

Speaker: Gilmore Hodge
Line: Mmm… We gonna wrassle. Cause I got a few moves I know you’ll like.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Agent Carter.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Colonel Phillips.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: I see you’re breaking in the candidates. That’s good. Get your ass up out of that dirt and stand in that line at attention til somebody comes tells you what to do.

Speaker: Gilmore Hodge
Line: Yes, sir.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: General Patton has said that wars are fought with weapons but they are won by men. We are going to win this war because we have the best men… And because they’re gonna get better. Much better. The Strategic Scientific Reserve is an Allied effort made up of the best minds in the free world. Our goal is to create the best army in history. But every army starts with one man. At the end of this week we will choose that man. He will be the first in a new breed of super-soldiers.

Speaker: Sergeant Duffy
Line: Rogers. Get that rifle out of the mud.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: And they, will personally escort Adolf Hitler to the gates of Hell.

Speaker: Sergeant Duffy
Line: Pick up the pace, ladies. Let’s go. Double time. Come on. Faster. Faster. Move. Move. Squad, halt. That flag means we’re only at the halfway point. First man to bring it to me gets a ride back with Agent Carter. Move, move.

Speaker: Soldiers
Line: Come on. Get up there.

Speaker: Sergeant Duffy
Line: If that’s all you got, this army’s in trouble. Get up there, Hodge. Come on. Get up there. Nobody’s got that flag in 17 years. Now fall back into line. Come on, fall in. Let’s go. Get back into formation. Rogers. I said fall in.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Thank you, sir.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Faster, ladies. Come on. My grandmother has more life in her, God rest her soul. Move it.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: You’re not really thinking about picking Rogers, are you.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: I am more than just thinking about it. He is the clear choice.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: When you brought a ninety-pound asthmatic onto my army base, I let it slide. I thought, what the hell. Maybe he’ll be useful to you, like a gerbil. I never thought you’d pick him.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Up.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: You stick a needle in that kids arm and it’s gonna go right through him.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Come on, girls.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Look at that. He’s making me cry.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: I am looking for qualities beyond the physical.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Do you know how long it took to set up this project.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Yeah, I know.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: All the groveling I had to do in front of Senator What’s-His-Name’s committees.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Brandt. Yes, I know. I am well aware of your efforts.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Then throw me a bone. Hodge passed every test we gave him. He’s big, he’s fast, he obeys orders. He’s a soldier.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: He’s a bully.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: You don’t win wars with niceness, doctor. You win war with guts. Grenade.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Get away. Get back.

Speaker: Officer
Line: It was a dummy grenade. All clear. Back in formation.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Is this is a test.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: He’s still skinny.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: May I.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Yeah.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Can’t sleep.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I got the jitters, I guess.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Me, too.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Can I ask you a question.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Just one.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Why me.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: I suppose that is the only question that matters. This is from Augsburg. My city. So many people forget that the first country that the Nazi’s invaded was their own. You know, after the last war the… my people struggled. They… they felt weak. They felt small. And then Hitler comes along with the marching and the big show and the flags and the… and the… And he… he hears of me, my work and he finds me. And he says, You. He says, You will make us strong. Well, I am not interested. So he sends the head of HYDRA, his research division. A brilliant scientist by the name of Johann Schmidt. Now, Schmidt is a member of the inner circle and he’s ambitious. He and Hitler share a passion for occult power and Teutonic myth. Hitler uses his fantasies to inspire his followers. But for Schmidt, it is not fantasy. For him, it is real. He has become convinced that there is a great power hidden in the earth, left here by the Gods, waiting to be seized by a superior man. So when he hears about my formula and what it can do, he cannot resist.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Schmidt must become that superior man.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Did it make him stronger.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Yeah. But, there were other effects. The serum was not ready. But more important, the man. The serum amplifies everything that is inside. So, good becomes great. Bad becomes worse. This is why you were chosen. Because a strong man, who has known power all his life, will lose respect for that power. But a weak man knows the value of strength, and knows compassion.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Thanks. I think.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Whatever happens tomorrow, you must promise me one thing. That you will stay who you are. Not a perfect soldier, but a good man.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: To the little guys.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: No. No. Wait. Wait. What I am doing. No. You have a procedure tomorrow. No fluids.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: All right. We’ll drink it after.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: No. I don’t have procedure tomorrow. Drink it after. Drink it now.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Is there something in particular you need.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: I understand you found him.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: See for yourself. You disapprove.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: I just don’t see why you need concern yourself. I can’t imagine he will succeed. Again.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: His serum is the Allies’ only defence against this power we now possess. If we take it away from them, then our victory is assured.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Shall I give the order.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: It has been given.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Good.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Dr Zola. What do you think.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: A masterpiece.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I know this neighborhood. I got beat up in that alley. And that parking lot. And behind that diner.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Did you have something against running away.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You start running they’ll never let you stop. You stand up, push back. Can’t say no forever, right.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: I know a little of what that’s like. To have every door shut in your face.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I guess I just don’t why you’d wanna join the army if you’re a beautiful dame. Or a beautiful… a woman. An agent, not a dame. You are beautiful, but…

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You have no idea how to talk to a woman, do you.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: This is the longers conversation I’ve had with one. Women aren’t exactly lining up to dance with a guy they might step on.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You must have danced.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Well, asking a woman to dance always seems so terrifying. And the past few years just didn’t seem to matter that much. Figured I’d wait.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: For what.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: The right partner.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: This way.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: What are we doing here.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Follow me.

Speaker: Antique Store Owner
Line: Wonderful weather this morning isn’t it.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Yes, but I always carry an umbrella.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Good morning. Please, not now. Are you ready. Good. Take off your shirt, your tie and your hat.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Senator Brandt, glad you could make it.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: Why exactly am I in Brooklyn.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: We needed access to the city’s power grid. Of course, if you’d given me the generators I requisitioned…

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: A lot of people are asking for funds, Colonel. Oh, this is…

Speaker: Heinz Kruger
Line: Fred Clemson, State Department. If this project of yours comes through, we’d like to see it used for something other than headlines.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: Jesus. Somebody get that kid a sandwich.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Comfortable.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: It’s a little big. You save me any of that schnapps.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Not as much as I should have. Sorry. Next time. Mr Stark, how are your levels.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Levels at 100%.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Good.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: We may dim half the lights in Brooklyn, but we are ready as we’ll ever be.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Agent Carter. Don’t you think you would be more comfortable in the booth.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Oh, yes. Of course. Sorry.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Good. Do you hear me. is this on. Ladies and gentlemen, today we take not another step towards annihilation, but the first step on the path to peace. We begin with a series of micro injections into the subjects major muscle groups. The serum infusion will cause immediate cellular change. And then to stimulate growth, the subject will be saturated with Vita-Rays.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: That wasn’t so bad.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: That was penicillin. Serum infusion beginning in five, four, three, two, one. Now, Mr Stark. Steven, can you hear me.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: It’s probably too late to go to the bathroom, right.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: We will proceed.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: That’s ten percent. Twenty percent. Thirty. That’s 40 %.

Speaker: SSR Doctor
Line: Vital signs are normal.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: That’s 50 %. Sixty. Seventy.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Steven.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Shut it down.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Steven.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Shut it down.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Kill the reactor, Mr Stark. Turn it off. Kill it. Kill the reactor.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: No. Don’t. I can do this.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Eighty. Ninety. That’s 100 %.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Mr Stark.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Steven. Steven.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: The son of a bitch did it.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I did it.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Yeah, yeah. I think we did it.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: We actually did it.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: How do you feel.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Taller.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You look taller.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: How do you like Brooklyn now, Senator.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: I can think of some folks in Berlin who are about to get very nervous. Congratulations, Doctor.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Thank you, sir.

Speaker: Dr. Abraham Erskine
Line: Stop him.

Speaker: Taxi Driver
Line: What are you doing. Buddy, are you all right. Hey, this guy’s been shot.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Sorry. I’m sorry. Whoa, whoa, whoa.

Speaker: Mother
Line: No. No. Not my son.

Speaker: Young Boy
Line: Stop it.

Speaker: Mother
Line: Don’t hurt him.

Speaker: Heinz Kruger
Line: Get back.

Speaker: Young Boy
Line: Let me go.

Speaker: Mother
Line: Let go of my son. Don’t hurt him.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Wait, don’t. Don’t. No. Don’t.

Speaker: Young Boy
Line: Go get him. I can swim.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Who the hell are you.

Speaker: Heinz Kruger
Line: The first of many. Cut off one head, two more shall take its place. Hail HYDRA.

Speaker: Hutter
Line: The Führer is not accustomed to being ignored, Herr Schmidt. He funds your research because you promised him weapons.

Speaker: Schneider
Line: You serve at his pleasure. He gave you this facility as a reward for your injuries.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Reward. Call it what it is. Exile. I no longer reflect his image of Aryan perfection.

Speaker: Roeder
Line: You think this is about appearances. Your HYDRA division has failed to deliver so much as a rifle in over a year. And we had learned through local intelligence you had mounted a full-scale incursion into Norway.

Speaker: Schneider
Line: The Führer feels… How does he put it. The Red Skull has been indulged long enough.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Gentlemen, you have come to see the results of our work. Let me show you. Hitler speaks of a thousand-year Reich, but he cannot feed his army for a month. His troops spill their blood across every field in Europe. But still he is no closer to achieving his goals.

Speaker: Roeder
Line: And I suppose you still aim to end this war through magic.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Science. But I understand your confusion. Great power has always baffled primitive men. HYDRA is assembling an arsenal to destroy my enemies in one stroke. Where ever they are, regardless of how many forces they possess. All in a matter of hours.

Speaker: Roeder
Line: Your enemies.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: My weapons contain enough destructive power to decimate every hostile capital on earth. Quite simply, gentlemen, I have harnessed the power of the Gods.

Speaker: Schneider
Line: Thank you, Schmidt.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: For what.

Speaker: Schneider
Line: For making it clear how obviously mad you are.

Speaker: Hutter
Line: Berlin is on this map.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: So it is.

Speaker: Hutter
Line: You will be punished for your insolence. You will be brought before the Führer himself.

Speaker: Roeder
Line: Schmidt.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: My apolpgies, Doctor, but we both knew HYDRA could grow no further in Hitler’s shadow. Hail HYDRA.

Speaker: HYDRA technicians
Line: Hail HYDRA.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Hail HYDRA.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Think you got enough.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Any hope of reproducing a program is locked in your genetic code. But without Dr Erskine, it could take years.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: He deserved more than this.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: If it could only work once, he’d be proud it was you.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: Colonel Phillips, my committee is demanding answers.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Great. Why don’t we start with how a German spy got a ride to my secret installation in your car. What have we got here.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Speaking modestly, I’m the best mechanical engineer in this country. But I don’t know what’s inside this thing or how it works. We’re not even close to this technology.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: Then who is.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: HYDRA. I’m sure you’ve been reading our briefings.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: I’m on a number of committees, Colonel.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: HYDRA is the Nazi deep science division. It’s led by Johann Schmidt. But he has much bigger ambitions.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: HYDRA’s practically a cult. They worship Schmidt, they think he’s invincible.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: So what are you gonna do about it.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Spoke to the president this morning. As of today the SSR is being retasked.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Colonel.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: We are taking the fight to HYDRA. Pack your bags Agent Carter. You too, Stark. You’re flying to London tonight.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Sir, if you’re going after Schmidt, I want in.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: You’re an experiment. You’re going to Alamogordo.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: The serum worked.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: I asked for an army and all I got was you. You are not enough.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: With all due respect to the Colonel, I think we may be missing the point. I’ve seen you in action, Steve. More importantly, the country’s seen it. Paper., headlines: Nazis in New York - mystery man saves child] The enlistment lines have been around the block since your picture hit the newsstands. You don’t take a soldier, a symbol like that, and hide him in a lab. Son, do you want to serve your country on the most important battlefield of the war.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Sir, that’s all I want.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: Then, congratulations. You just got promoted.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I don’t know if I can do this.

Speaker: Brandt’s Aide
Line: Nothing to it. Sell off a few bonds, bonds buy bullets, bullets kills Nazi’s. Bing bang boom. You’re an American hero.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: It’s just not how I pictured getting there.

Speaker: Brandt’s Aide
Line: The senator’s got a lot of pull up on the hill. You play ball with us, you’ll be leading your own platoon in no time. Take the shield.

Speaker: USO Singer
Line: Who’s strong and brave, here to save the American way.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Not all of us can storm a beach or drive a tank. But there’s still a way all of us can fight.

Speaker: USO Singer
Line: Who vows to fight like a man, for what’s right, night and day.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Series E Defence Bonds. Each one you buy is a bullet in the barrel of your best guy’s gun.

Speaker: USO Singer
Line: Who will campaign door-to-door for America. Carry the flag shore to shore for America. From Hoboken to Spokane, the star-spangeld man with a plan.

Speaker: Director
Line: Cut. Guys, don’t look ath the camera.

Speaker: USO Singer
Line: We can’t ignore there’s a threat and a war we must win.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Each one you buy is a bullet in the barrel of your best guy’s gun.

Speaker: USO Singer
Line: Who’ll hang a noose on the goose-stepping goons from Berlin. Who will redeem, heed the call for America. Who’ll rise or fall, give his all for America. Who’s here to prove that we can. The star-spangled man with a plan.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: We all know this is about trying to win the war. We can’t do that without bullets and bandages, tanks and tents. That’s where you come in. Every bond you buy will help protect someone you love.

Speaker: Kids in USO Audience
Line: Turn around. He’s right behind you.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Keep our boys armed and ready, and the Germans will think twice about trying to get the drop on us.

Speaker: USO Singer
Line: Stalwart and steady and true, forcefull and ready to defend, the red, white, and blue. Who’ll give the Axis the sack and is smart as a fox. Far as an eagle will soar. Who’s making Adolf afraid to step out of his box. He knows what we’re fighting for. Who waked the giant that napped in America. We know it’s no one but Captain America. Who’ll finish what they began. Who’ll kick the Krauts to Japan. The star-spangled man with a aplan.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: How many of you ready to help me sock old Adolf on the jaw. Okay. Uh… I need a volunteer.

Speaker: Army Heckler#1
Line: I already volunteered. How do you think I got here. Bring back the girls.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I think they only know the one song. But um…let me…I’ll…I’ll see what I can do.

Speaker: Army Heckler#1
Line: You do that, sweetheart.

Speaker: Army Heckler#2
Line: Nice boots, Tinker Bell.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Come on, guys. We’re all on the same team here.

Speaker: Army Heckler#3
Line: Hey, Captain. Sign this.

Speaker: Army Heckler#4
Line: Bring back the girls.

Speaker: Brandt’s Aide
Line: Don’t worry, pal. They’ll warm up to you. Don’t worry.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Hello, Steve.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Hi.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Hi.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: What are you doin’ here.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Officially I’m not here at all. That was quite a performance.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Yeah. Uh… I had to improvise a little bit. Crowds I’m used to are usually more uh… twelve.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: I understand you’re America’s New Hope.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Bond sales take a ten percent bump in every state I visit.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Is that Senator Brandt I hear.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: At least he’s got me doin’ this. Phillips would have had be stuck in lab.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: And these are your only two options. A lab rat or a dancing monkey. You were meant for more than this, you know. What.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You know for the longest time I dreamed about coming overseas and being on the front lines. Serving my country. I finally get everything I wanted, and I’m wearing tights. They look like they’ve been through hell.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: These men more than most. Schmidt sent out a force to Azzano. Two hundred men went up against him and less than fifty returned. Your audience contained what was left of the one-oh-seventh. The rest were killed or captured.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: The one-oh-seventh.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: What.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Come on. Colonel Phillips.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Well, if it isn’t the Star-Spangled Man With A Plan. And what is your plan today.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I need the casualty list from Azzano.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: You don’t get to give me orders, son.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I just need one name. Sergeant James Barnes from the hundred and seventh.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: You and I are gonna have a conversation later that you won’t enjoy.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Please tell me if he’s alive, sir. B-A-R…

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: I can spell. I have signed more of these condolence letters today than I would care to count. But the name does sound familiar. I’m sorry.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: What about the others. Are you planning a rescue mission.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Yeah. It’s called winning the war.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: But if you know where they are, why not at least….

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: They’re thirty miles behind the lines. Through the most heavily fortified territory in Europe. We’d lose more men than we’d save. But I don’t expect you to understand that, because you’re a chorus girl.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I think I understand just fine.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Well then understand it somewhere else. If I read the posters correctly, you got some place to be in thirty minutes.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Yes, sir. I do.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: If you have something to say, right now is the perfect time to keep it to yourself.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: What do you plan to do. Walk to Austria.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: If that’s what it takes.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You heard the Colonel, your friend is most likely dead.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You don’t know that.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Even so, he’s devising a strategy. If he detects…

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: By the time he’s done that, it could be too late. You told me you thought I was meant for more than this. Did you mean that.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Every word.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Then you gotta let me go.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: I can do more than that.

Speaker: Brandt’s Aide
Line: On stage, girls. Five minutes.

Speaker: USO girl
Line: Where’s my helmet.

Speaker: Brandt’s Aide
Line: Has anyone seen Rogers.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: The HYDRA camp is in Krausberg, tucked between these two mountain ranges. It’s a factory of some kind.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: We should be able to drop you right on the doorstep.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Just get me as close as you can. You know, you two are gonna be in a lot of trouble at the lab.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: And you won’t.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Where I’m goin’, if anybody yells at me I can just shoot ‘em.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: They will undoubtedly shoot back.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Well, let’s hope it’s good for somethin’.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Agent Carter, if we’re not in too much of a hurry I thought we could stop off in Lucerne for a late night fondue.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Stark is the best civilian pilot I’ve ever seen. He’s mad enough to brave this airspace, we’re lucky to have him.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: So are you two…. Do you…. Fondue.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: This is your transponder. Activate it when you’re ready and the signal will lead us straight to you.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Are you sure this thing works.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: It’s been tested more than you, pal.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Get back here. We’re taking you all the way in.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: As soon as I’m free, you turn this thing around and get the hell outta here.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You can’t give me orders.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: The hell I can’t. I’m a Captain.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: As you can see, production of the Valkyrie is progressing on schedule, even with components of this size.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Increase the output by 60 % and see to it our other facilities do the same.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: But the prisoners, I’m not sure they have the strength.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Then use up what strength they have left, Doctor. There are always more workers.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Not now.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: You know, Fritz, one of these days, I’m gonna have a stick of my own.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Fellas.

Speaker: HYDRA guards
Line: Ah.

Speaker: Gabe Jones
Line: Who are you supposed to be.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I’m… Captain America.

Speaker: James Montgomery Falsworth
Line: I beg your pardon.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: What, are we taking everybody.

Speaker: Jim Morita
Line: I’m from Fresno, Ace.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Is there anybody else. I’m looking for a Sergeant James Barnes.

Speaker: James Montgomery Falsworth
Line: There’s an isolation ward in the factory, but no one’s ever come back from it.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: All right. The tree line is northwest, 80 yards past the gate. Get out fast and give ‘em hell. I’ll meet you guys in the clearing with anybody else I find.

Speaker: Gabe Jones
Line: Wait. You know what you’re doin’.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Yeah. I’ve knocked out Adolf Hitler over two hundred times.

Speaker: Jim Morita
Line: You know how to use that thing. Okay.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: What is happening.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: Hey. Not exactly a Buick.

Speaker: Gabe Jones
Line: That one. Zündung.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: Zündung.

Speaker: James Montgomery Falsworth
Line: Get this thing going, Dugan.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: I didn’t know you spoke German.

Speaker: Gabe Jones
Line: Three semesters at Howards, switched to French, girls much cuter.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: Didn’t ask for the resume.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: No, no. What are you doing.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Our forces are outmatched.

Speaker: Jim Morita
Line: Keep moving. Grab those grenades.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Sergeant. 32557…

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Bucky. Oh, my God.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Is that…

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: It’s me. It’s Steve.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Steve.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Come on.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Steve.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I thought you were dead.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: I thought you were smaller.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Come on.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: What happened to you.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I joined the Army.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Did it hurt.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: A little.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Is it permanent.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: So far.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Captain America. How exciting. I’m a great fan of your films. So Dr Erskine managed it after all. Not exactly an improvement, but still impressive.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You’ve got no idea.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Haven’t I. No matter what lies Erskine told you, you see I was his greatest success.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: You don’t have one of those, do you.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: You are deluded, Captain. You pretend to be a simple soldier, but in reality you are just afraid to admit that we have left humanity behind. Unlike you, I embrace it proudly. Without fear.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Then how come you’re running. Come on, let’s go. Up.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Sir. Are we going to the roof. What about me. Where will I sit.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Not a scratch, Doctor. Not a scratch.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Let’s go. One at a time.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Gotta be a rope or something.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Just go. Get out of here.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: No. Not without you.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Senator Brandt, I regret to report that Captain Steven G. Rogers went missing behind enemy lines on the third. Aerial reconnaissance has proven unfruitful. As a result, I must declare Captain Rogers killed in action. Period.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: The last surveillance flight is back. No sign of activity.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Go get a cup of coffee, Corporal.

Speaker: Corporal
Line: Yes, sir.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: I can’t touch Stark. He’s rich and he’s the Army’s number one weapons contractor. You are neither one.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: With respect, sir, I don’t regret my actions. And I don’t think Captain Rogers did either.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: What makes you think I give a damn about your opinions. I took a chance with you, Agent Carter. And now America’s golden boy and a lot of other good men are dead, cause you had a crush.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: It wasn’t that. I had faith.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Well, I hope that’s a big comfort to you when they shut this division down. What the hell’s going on out there.

Speaker: Man#1
Line: Look who it is.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Some of theres men need medical attention.

Speaker: Man#2
Line: Medic, we got wounded.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I’d like to surrender myself for disciplinary action.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: That won’t be necessary.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Yes, sir.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Faith, huh.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You’re late.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Couldn’t call my ride.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Hey. Let’s hear it for Captain America.

Speaker: Senator Brandt
Line: I am honoured to present this medal for valour to my personal friend, Captain America. Captain America. Captain, that’s your cue.

Speaker: General
Line: I thought he’d be taller.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: The fifth one was here in Poland, right near the Baltic. And the sixth one was… about here, 30, 40 miles west of the Maginot Line. I just got a quick look.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Well, nobody’s perfect.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: These are the weapon factories we know about. Sergeant Barnes said that Hydra shipped all the parts to another facility that isn’t on this map.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Agent Carter, coordinate with MI6. I want every Allied eyeball looking for that main Hydra base.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: What about us.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: We are gonna set a fire under Johann Schmidt’s ass. What do you say, Rogers. It’s your map, you think you can wipe Hydra off of it.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Yes, sir. I’ll need a team.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: We’re already putting together the best men.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: With all due respect, sir. So am I.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: So, let’s get this straight.

Speaker: Gabe Jones
Line: We barely got out of there alive, and you want us to go back.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Pretty much.

Speaker: James Montgomery Falsworth
Line: Sounds rather fun, actually.

Speaker: Jim Morita
Line: I’m in.

Speaker: Gabe Jones
Line: We’re in.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: Hell, I’ll always fight. But you got to do one thing for me.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: What’s that.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: Open a tab.

Speaker: Jim Morita
Line: Well, that was easy.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Another round.

Speaker: Barkeeper
Line: Where are they putting all this stuff.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: ] See. I told you. They’re all idiots.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: How about you. You ready to follow Captain America into the jaws of death.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Hell, no. That little guy from Brooklyn who was too dumb not to run away from a fight. I’m following him. But you’re keeping the outfit, right.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You know what. It’s kind of growing on me.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Captain.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Agent Carter.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Ma’am.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Howard has some equipment for you to try. Tomorrow morning.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Sounds good.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: I see you top squad is prepping for duty.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: You don’t like music.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: I do, actually. I might even, when this is all over, go dancing.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Then what are we waiting for.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Yes, ma’m. I’ll be there.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: I’m invisible. I’m…I’m turning into you. It’s like some horrible dream.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Don’t take it so hard. Maybe she’s got a friend.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Emission signature is unusual. Alpha and beta ray neutral. Though I doubt Rogers picked up on that. Seems harmless enough. Hard to see what all the fuss is about. Write that down.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Excuse me. I’m looking for Mr Stark.

Speaker: Pvt. Lorraine
Line: He’s in with Colonel Phillips. Of course you’re welcome to wait. I read about what you did.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Oh. The…yeah. Well, that’s you know. Just doin’ what needed to be done.

Speaker: Pvt. Lorraine
Line: Sounded like more than that. You saved nearly four hundred men.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Really, it’s not a big deal.

Speaker: Pvt. Lorraine
Line: Tell that to their wives.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Uh…I don’t think they were all married.

Speaker: Pvt. Lorraine
Line: You’re a hero.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Well, that…you know. That…that depends on the definition of it really.

Speaker: Pvt. Lorraine
Line: The women of America, they owe you their thanks. And uh…seeing as they’re not here.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Captain. We’re ready for you. If you’re not otherwise occupied.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Agent Carter, wait.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Looks like finding a partner wasn’t that hard after all.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Peggy, that’s not what you thought it was.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: I don’t think anything, Captain. Not one thing. You always wanted to be soldier and now you are. Just like all the rest.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Well, what about you and Stark. How do I know you two haven’t been… fonduing.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You still don’t know a bloody thing about women.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Fondue is just cheese and bread, my friend.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Really. I didn’t think…

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Nor should you, pal. The moment you think you know what’s goin’ on in a woman’s head, it’s the moment your goose is well and truly cooked. Me, I concentrate on work. Which at the moment is about making sure you and your men do not get killed. Carbon polymer. Should withstand your average German bayonet. Although Hydra’s not going to attack you with a pocket knife. I hear you’re uh… kinda attached.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: It’s handier than you might think.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: I took the liberty of coming up with some options. This one’s fun. She’s been fitted with electrical relays. It’ll allow you to…

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: What about this one.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: No. No. That’s just a prototype.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: What’s it made of.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Vibranium. It’s stronger than steel and a third of the weight. It’s completely vibration absorbent.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: How come it’s not a standard issue.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: That’s the rarest metal on earth. What you’re holding there. That’s all we’ve got.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You quite finished, Mr Stark. I’m sure the Captain has some unfinished business.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: What do you think.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Yes. I think it works.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I had some ideas about the uniform.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Whatever you want, pal.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: You are failing. We are close to an offensive network that will shake the planet. And yet we are continually delayed, because you cannot outwit a simpleton with a shield.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: This is hardly my area of expertise. I…I merely develop the weapons. I…I cannot fire them.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Finish your mission, Doctor. Before the American finishes his.

Speaker: Guard
Line: Sir.

Speaker: Facility Manager
Line: I’m sorry, Herr Schmidt. We fought to the last man.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Evidently not.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: Remember when I made you ride the Cyclone at Coney Island.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Yeah, I and I threw up.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: This isn’t payback, is it.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Now why would I do that.

Speaker: Gabe Jones
Line: We were right. Dr Zola’s on the train. Hydra dispatcher gave him permission to open up the throttle. Wherever he’s going, they must need him bad.

Speaker: James Montgomery Falsworth
Line: Let’s get going, because they’re moving like the devil.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: We only got about a 10-second window. You miss that window, we’re bugs on a windshield.

Speaker: James Montgomery Falsworth
Line: Mind the gap.

Speaker: Dum Dum Dugan
Line: Better get moving, bugs.

Speaker: Jacques Dernier
Line: Maintenant.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Stop him. Fire again.

Speaker: James Barnes
Line: I had him on the ropes.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I know you did. Get down.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Fire again. Kill him. Now.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Bucky. Hang on. Grab my hand. NO.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Sit down.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: What is this.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Steak.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: What is in it.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Cow. Doctor, do you realize how difficult it is to get ahold of a prime cut like that out here.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: I don’t eat meat.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Why not.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: It disagrees with me.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: How about cyanide. Does that give you the rumbly tummy too. Every Hydra agent that we’ve tried to take alive has crunched a little pill before we can stop him. But not you. So, here’s my brilliant theory. You wanna live.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: You’re trying to intimidate me, Colonel.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: I bought you dinner.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: ‘Given the variable information he has provided, and in exchange for his full cooperation, Dr Zola is being remanded to Switzerland.’

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: I sent that message to Washington this morning. Of course it was encoded. You guys haven’t broken those codes, have you. That would be awkward.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Schmidt will know this is a lie.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: He’s gonna kill you anyway, Doc. You’re a liability. You know more about Schmidt than anyone. And the last guy you cost us was Captain Rogers’ closest friend. So, I wouldn’t count on the very best of protection. There’s you or Schmidt. It’s just the hand you’ve been dealt.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Schmidt believes he walks in the foot steps of the Gods.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Mmm.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Only the world itself will satisfy him.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: You do realize that’s nuts, don’t you.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: But the sanity of the plan is of no consequence.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: And why is that.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: Because he can do it.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: What’s his target.

Speaker: Dr. Arnim Zola
Line: His target… is everywhere.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Tomorrow, Hydra will stand master of the world. Born to victory on the wings of the Valkyrie. Our enemies weapons will be powerless against us. If they shoot down one plane, hundreds more will rain fire upon them. If they cut off one head, two more shall take its place. Hail Hydra.

Speaker: Man on the Radio
Line: Blackout is still in effect throughout the London area. Please wait for the all-clear. Your attention, please. All citizens shall remain indoors until further notice. Blackout is still in effect throughout the London area.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Dr Erskine said that… the serum wouldn’t just effect my muscles, it would effect my cells. Create a protective system of regeneration and healing. Which means um…I can’t get drunk. Did you know that.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Your metabolism burns four times faster than the average person. He thought it could be one of the side effects. It wasn’t your fault.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Did you read the reports.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Yes.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Then you know that’s not true.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You did everything you could. Did you believe in your friend. Did you respect him. Then stop blaming yourself. Allow Barnes the dignity of his choice. He damn well must have thought you were worth it.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I’m goin’ after Schmidt. I’m not gonna stop till all of Hydra is dead or captured.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: You won’t be alone.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Johann Schmidt belongs in a bug house. He thinks he’s a God. He’s willing to blow up half the world to prove it, starting with the USA.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Schmidt’s working with powers beyond our capabilities. He gets across the Atlantic, he will wipe out the entire eastern sea board in an hour.

Speaker: Gabe Jones
Line: How much time we got.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: According to my new best friend, under twenty four hours.

Speaker: Jaques Dernier
Line: Where is he now.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Hydra’s last base is here. In the Alps. Five hundred feet below the surface.

Speaker: Jim Morita
Line: So, what are we supposed to do. I mean, it’s not like we can just knock on the front door.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Why not. That’s exactly what we’re gonna do.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Arrogance may not be a uniquely American trait, but I must say you do it better than anyone. But there are limits to what even you can do, Captain. Or did Erskine tell you otherwise.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: He told me you were insane.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Ah. He resented my genius and tried to deny me what was rightfully mine. But he gave you everything. So, what made you so special.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Nothin’. I’m just a kid from Brooklyn. I can do this all day.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: Oh, of course you can. Of course. But unfortunately I am on a tight schedule.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: So am I.

Speaker: James Montgomery Falsworth
Line: Rogers. You might need this.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Thanks.

Speaker: Jim Morita
Line: We’re in. Assault team, go.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Move out. Keep your spacing.

Speaker: Hydra Soldier
Line: Cutt off one head, two more shall…

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: Let’s go find two more.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You’re late.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Weren’t you about to…

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Right. Keep it steady.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Wait. Go get him.

Speaker: Col. Chester Phillips
Line: I’m not kissin’ you.

Speaker: Johann Schmidt
Line: You don’t give up, do you.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Nope.

Speaker: Johan Schmidt
Line: You could have the power of the gods. Yet you wear a flag on your chest and think you fight a battle of nations. I have seen the future, Captain. There are no flags.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Not my future.

Speaker: Johan Schmidt/Red Skull
Line: What have you done. No.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Come in. This is Captain Rogers. Do you read me.

Speaker: Jim Morita
Line: Captain Rogers, what is your…

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Steve, is that you. Are you alright.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Peggy. Schmidt’s dead.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: What about the plane.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: That’s a little bit tougher to explain.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Give me your coordinates, I’ll find you a safe landing site.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: There’s not going to be a safe landing. But I can try and force it down.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: I’ll get Howard on the line, he’ll know what to do.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: There’s not enough time. This thing’s moving too fast and it’s heading for New York. I gotta put her in the water.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Please, don’t do this. We have time. We can work it out.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Right now I’m in the middle of nowhere. If I wait any longer a lot of people are gonna die. Peggy, this is my choice. Peggy.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: I’m here.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: I’m gonna need a rain check on that dance.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Alright. A week, next Saturday, at the Stork Club.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You got it.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Eight o’clock on the dot. Don’t you dare be late. Understood.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You know, I still don’t know how to dance.

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: I’ll show you how. Just be there.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: We’ll have the band play somethin’ slow. I’d hate to step on your…

Speaker: Peggy Carter
Line: Steve. Steve. Steve.

Speaker: James Montgomery Falsworth
Line: To the Captain.

Speaker: Stark’s Engineer
Line: Sir.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Take us to the next grid point.

Speaker: Stark’s Engineer
Line: But there’s not trace of wreckage. And the energy signature stops here.

Speaker: Howard Stark
Line: Just keep looking.

Speaker: Dodgers Announcer
Line: Curve ball, high and outside for ball one. So the Dodgers are tied, 4-4. And the crowd well knows that with one swing of his bat, this fellow’s capable of making it a brand-new game again. Just an absolutely gorgeous day here at Ebbets Field. The Phillies have managed to tie up at 4-4. But the Dodgers have three men on. Pearson beaned Reiser in Philadelphia last month. Wouldn’t the youngster like a hit here to return the favour. Pete leans in. Here’s the pitch. Swung on. A line to the right. And it gets past Rizzo. Three runs will score. Reiser heads to third. Durocher’s going to wave him in. Here comes the relay, but they won’t get him.

Speaker: SHIELD Agent
Line: Good morning. Or should I say, afternoon.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Where am I.

Speaker: SHIELD Agent
Line: You’re in a recovery room in New York city.

Speaker: Dodgers Announcer
Line: The Dodgers take the lead, 8-4. Oh, Dodgers. Everyone is on their feet. What a game we have here today, folks. What a game indeed.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Where am I really.

Speaker: SHIELD Agent
Line: I’m afraid I don’t understand.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: The game, it’s from May, nineteen forty one. I know, cause I was there. Now, I’m gonna ask you again. Where am I.

Speaker: SHIELD Agent
Line: Captain Rogers…

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Who are you.

Speaker: SHIELD Agent
Line: Captain Rogers, wait. All agents, code 13. I repeat. All agents, code 13.

Speaker: Nick Fury
Line: At ease, soldier. Look, I’m sorry about that little show back there, but… we thought it best to break it to you slowly.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Break what.

Speaker: Nick Fury
Line: You’ve been asleep, Cap. For almost seventy years. You gonna be okay.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Yeah. Yeah. I just…I had a date.

Speaker: Nick Fury
Line: Trouble sleeping.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: You’re here with a mission, sir.

Speaker: Nick Fury
Line: I am.

Speaker: Steve Rogers
Line: Trying to get me back in the world.

Speaker: Nick Fury
Line: Trying to save it.
